tool.name: calcVG_PTFs
tool.displayname: 01 Calculate van Genuchten parameters and plot SMRC

param.name: Output_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder name where output from this tool should be stored.

param.name: Input_shapefile
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename of the input soil shapefile. Soil shapefile can be polygon or point vector which includes required soil properties of the selected PTFs and a required field named "soilname" which contains the soils' name/identifier.

param.name: VG_of_choice
param.displayname: PTFs of choice for van Genuchten model
param.expression: Wosten et al. (1999) topsoil | Wosten et al. (1999) subsoil | Vereecken et al. (1989) | Zacharias and Wessolek (2007) | Weynants et al. (2009) | Dashtaki et al. (2010) | Hodnett and Tomasella (2002)
param.dialogReference:
Select the PTFs of interest from the dropdown list. Here are the current PTFs options and their required inputs:

(1) Temperate climate

- Wösten et al., (1999) topsoil and subsoil: Sand, Silt, Clay, Organic Matter, Bulk Density

- Wösten et al., (1999) topsoil and subsoil: Sand, Silt, Clay, Organic Matter, Bulk Density

- Vereecken et al., (1989): Sand, Silt, Clay, Organic Carbon, Bulk Density

- Zacharias and Wessolek (2007): Sand, Clay, Bulk Density

- Weynants et al. (2009): Sand, Silt, Clay, Organic Carbon, Bulk Density

(2) Tropical climate

- Hodnett and Tomasella (2002): Sand, Silt, Clay, Organic Carbon, Bulk Density; CEC

(3) Arid climate

- Dashtaki et al. (2010)

param.name: Pressure_heads_VG
param.displayname: Specify pressures to calculate water content using van Genuchten and hydraulic conductivity using Mualem-van Genuchten model (space delimited)
param.dialogReference:
By default, the output shapefile will contain soil moisture retention/hydraulic conductivity at -1kPa, -3kPa, -10kPa, -33kPa, -100kPa, -200kPa, -1000kPa and -1500kPa.These will get written to the output shapefile.

Using this option, the user can customise the output to get soil moisture/hydraulic conductivity at the pressure of interest, in addition tothe default pressures.This information will get written to a csv file within the output folder.

param.name: FieldCapacity
param.displayname: Value of pressure (kPa) at field capacity
param.dialogReference: Specify pressure for field capacity. Field capacity is commonly between -10kPa to -100kPa. The default value is -33kPa.

param.name: SIC
param.displayname: Value of pressure (kPa) at water stress-induced stomata closure
param.dialogReference: Specify pressure for water stress-induced stomata closure. The default value is -100kPa.

param.name: PWP
param.displayname: Value of pressure (kPa) at permanent wilting point
param.dialogReference: Specify pressure for permanent wilting point. The default value is -1500kPa.

param.name: Carbon_content
param.displayname: If the selected PTF requires OC or OM, select which type is present in your dataset:
param.dialogReference: Specifying soil carbon information in the input data.

param.name: Conversion_factor
param.displayname: If the selected PTF requires OC or OM, enter the appropriate conversion factor to change OM to OC (or vice-versa):
param.dialogReference: You do not need to use this function if your dataset has the same type of soil carbon as required by the PTFs. If the selected PTFs require organic matter (OM) but the input data only has organic carbon (OC) or inversely, this function can be used to convert OM to OC and inversely. NB_PTFs gives default conversion factors (the Van Bemmelen factors): 1.724 to convert OC to OM and 0.58 to convert OM to OC. However,theuser can customise the factor by typinga converstion factorintothis field.

param.name: Pressure_units_plot
param.dialogReference: Selecting the pressure unit for plotting soil moisture result. NB_PTFs has three pressure unit options: kPa, cm and m.

param.name: Plot_axis
param.displayname: Create water content and pressure plots with water content or hydraulic conductivity on the X-axis or Y-axis:
param.dialogReference: Choose which axis water content (when using van Genuchten model) and hydraulic conductity (when using Mualem-van Genuchten model) will be plotted on.

param.name: Calculate_MVG
param.displayname: Estimate unsaturated hydraulic conductivity and generate hydraulic conductivity curve using PTFs for Mualem van Genuchten model
param.dialogReference: Tick this box if you would like to obtain Mualem-van Genuchten model parameters and hydraulic conductivity pressure relationship. You must select either Wösten et al. (1999) or Weynants et al. (2009) PTFs.

tool.summary: This tool provides 7 PTFs to estimate van Genuchten model parameters and the soil-moisture pressure relationship. Among the PTFs, Wösten et al., (1999) (topsoil and subsoil)and Weynants et al. (2009) can be used to obtain Mualem van Genuchten model parameters and hydraulic conductivity pressure relationships. To select the PTFs of interest,theuser can use the guidelines given in the paper “Guidelines and a supporting toolbox for parameterising key soil hydraulic properties in hydrological studies and broader integrated modelling” (Dang et al., 2021).
